marklogic.body:
They'd have been rebuilt in the same style, like Dresden has been, as they are also among the world's great buildings. As the research and teaching have also been consistently among the very best in the world, strenuous efforts would have been made to preserve them too.
As it happens, the Luftwaffe deliberately avoided bombing Oxbridge during the Baedeker Raids that targeted other major cities because Hitler also recognised their importance and stature, and intended to maintain them, under the supervision of his own staff, if he succeeded in invading. It's not often that one agrees with Adolf, but on this occasion he was absolutely Spot on, and, given that they didn't destroy Oxbridge accidentally, so were his airmen.
